abstract: International Olympic Committee announces 16 Olympic athletes from 2008 and 2012 Olympic Games have been penalized for doping; announcement is latest in series related to retesting of urine samples from those game in wake of discovery of Russian state-run doping program, which has led to over 75 athletes being found guilty of doping violations; majority are from Russia and Eastern European countries, and some were medal winners, which has led to rewriting of Olympic history.

headline.print_headline: From 6th to Olympic Medalist: Doping Results Topple Podium
headline.main: Olympics History Rewritten: New Doping Tests Topple the Podium

snippet: Officials retesting urine samples have found scores of violations from the 2008 and 2012 Games, and medals are being stripped from dozens of athletes....
lead_paragraph: Officials retesting urine samples have found scores of violations from the 2008 and 2012 Games, and medals are being stripped from dozens of athletes.
